body.body: Dissect out mouse embryos in DMEM + 25 mM HEPES
Embryos should be staged by somite counting to avoid noise due to normal intra and inter litter variation in development
If rapid genotyping \(or assignment of genotype by phenotype) is possible embryos may be pooled, otherwise process separately in microtitre well plates

title: **B. CMFDG labelling of a single cell suspension**

body.body: In order to reduce background fluorescence block endogenous lysosomal β-galactosidase activity by incubating embryos in 0.3mM chloroquine diluted in DMEM + 25 mM HEPES containing 5% FCS and incubated at 37 °C, 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for 30 minutes
Rinse embryos three times in PBS, then incubate in 0.25% trypsin in PBS for approximately 30 minutes
During step 2 dissociate embryos into a single cell suspension by trituration every 5-10 minutes using plastic pipettes, starting with larger tips and moving down to smaller tips

Spin down the cell suspension at 300 x g for 3 minutes and resuspend in pre-warmed \(10 minutes at 37 °C) 50 μM CMDFG, 200 μM verapamil in 5% FCS/DMEM + 25 mM HEPES and incubate for 30 minutes at 37 °C, 5% CO2.  \(Note: the verapamil is used to inhibit efflux of the fluorescent, CMFDG-glutathione adduct from the cells \(3))
Place cells on ice and dilute to approximately 1-3 million cells/mL with 5% FCS/DMEM + 25 mM HEPES
Add 1mM PETG to stop the reaction
Add 1.5 μM propidium iodide to identify dead cells
Flow sort as soon as possible \(standard procedures)

For RNA isolation collect sorted cells immediately at 300 x g for 4 minutes and resuspended in 800 μl Trizol \(Gibco BRL).  250 μg/ml glycogen \(Roche) or 50 μg/mL Glycoblue \(Ambion) can be added as an RNA co-precipitant to improve yield
Homogenize cells by passing them twice through a 25-gauge needle \(shears genomic DNA) and store at -80 °C, or process immediately using standard techniques
For microarray, we found exponential amplification worked well \(4) and preserved transcript abundance
